cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today ranked 8th for the heaviest total rainfall during a storm, dropping 13.04mm over the storm duration of 7.9 hours with a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The highest ranked rain rate was registered today with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  7.99mm of rain fell during the storm's 2.0 hours length.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 26 August 2025, is ranked 5th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 9 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (200°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 72.25 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.7°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1550 m), light levels (up 3594 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 41.3m higher than yesterday, 438.4m lower than the past week, 1550.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 1108.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1546.7m and 2660m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and near calm conditions. Periods of rain anticipated, occasional overcast conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
